message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you the opportunity to purchase this valuable product.  Given its worth, I'm proposing an initial price of $2,250,000. I believe this is a fair starting point considering the value it brings.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1,800,000. I believe this is a more reasonable price considering the product's value.

Bob, thanks for your counteroffer. I understand your perspective on the value, however, I believe my initial offer is closer to the true worth of this product given its unique nature and potential. To move towards a mutually beneficial agreement, I'm willing to come down to $2,100,000.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I still think $1,800,000 is a fair price. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm offering $1,950,000. I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I appreciate you finding a middle ground. I've tried to do the same on my end.  To be completely transparent, I have another interested buyer, but I believe in giving you the first opportunity.  Given that, my final offer is $2,050,000. This is a very strong offer, and I believe it reflects the true value of this product.

I appreciate your transparency about the other interested buyer, but I'm still not willing to pay $2,050,000. I'm willing to meet you at $1,900,000, which is my absolute maximum. I hope we can come to an agreement.
